parameters.name: EndpointName
parameters.description: The name to be assigned to the new DevEndpoint.

parameters.name: RoleArn
parameters.description: The IAM role for the DevEndpoint.

parameters.name: SecurityGroupIds
parameters.description: Security group IDs for the security groups to be used by the new DevEndpoint. (string) ---

parameters.name: PublicKeys
parameters.description: A list of public keys to be used by the development endpoints for authentication. The use of this attribute is preferred over a single public key because the public keys allow you to have a different private key per client. (string) ---

parameters.name: WorkerType
parameters.description: The type of predefined worker that is allocated to the development endpoint. Accepts a value of Standard, G.1X, or G.2X. For the Standard worker type, each worker provides 4 vCPU, 16 GB of memory and a 50GB disk, and 2 executors per worker. For the G.1X worker type, each worker maps to 1 DPU (4 vCPU, 16 GB of memory, 64 GB disk), and provides 1 executor per worker. We recommend this worker type for memory-intensive jobs. For the G.2X worker type, each worker maps to 2 DPU (8 vCPU, 32 GB of memory, 128 GB disk), and provides 1 executor per worker. Known issue: when a development endpoint is created with the G.2X WorkerType configuration, the Spark drivers for the development endpoint will run on 4 vCPU, 16 GB of memory, and a 64 GB disk.

parameters.name: GlueVersion
parameters.description: Glue version determines the versions of Apache Spark and Python that Glue supports. The Python version indicates the version supported for running your ETL scripts on development endpoints. For more information about the available Glue versions and corresponding Spark and Python versions, see Glue version in the developer guide. Development endpoints that are created without specifying a Glue version default to Glue 0.9. You can specify a version of Python support for development endpoints by using the Arguments parameter in the CreateDevEndpoint or UpdateDevEndpoint APIs. If no arguments are provided, the version defaults to Python 2.

parameters.name: NumberOfWorkers
parameters.description: The number of workers of a defined workerType that are allocated to the development endpoint. The maximum number of workers you can define are 299 for G.1X, and 149 for G.2X.

parameters.name: ExtraPythonLibsS3Path
parameters.description: The paths to one or more Python libraries in an Amazon S3 bucket that should be loaded in your DevEndpoint. Multiple values must be complete paths separated by a comma.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to use with this DevEndpoint. You may use tags to limit access to the DevEndpoint. For more information about tags in Glue, see Amazon Web Services Tags in Glue in the developer guide. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: Arguments
parameters.description: A map of arguments used to configure the DevEndpoint. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_items.description: The name assigned to the new DevEndpoint.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status of the new DevEndpoint.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The security groups assigned to the new DevEndpoint.

nested_items.name: SubnetId
nested_items.description: The subnet ID assigned to the new DevEndpoint.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role assigned to the new DevEndpoint.

nested_items.name: YarnEndpointAddress
nested_items.description: The address of the YARN endpoint used by this DevEndpoint.

nested_items.name: ZeppelinRemoteSparkInterpreterPort
nested_items.description: The Apache Zeppelin port for the remote Apache Spark interpreter.

nested_items.name: NumberOfNodes
nested_items.description: The number of Glue Data Processing Units (DPUs) allocated to this DevEndpoint.

nested_items.name: WorkerType
nested_items.description: The type of predefined worker that is allocated to the development endpoint. May be a value of Standard, G.1X, or G.2X.

nested_items.name: GlueVersion
nested_items.description: Glue version determines the versions of Apache Spark and Python that Glue supports. The Python version indicates the version supported for running your ETL scripts on development endpoints.

nested_items.name: NumberOfWorkers
nested_items.description: The number of workers of a defined workerType that are allocated to the development endpoint.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Availability Zone where this DevEndpoint is located.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The ID of the virtual private cloud (VPC) used by this DevEndpoint.

nested_items.name: ExtraPythonLibsS3Path
nested_items.description: The paths to one or more Python libraries in an S3 bucket that will be loaded in your DevEndpoint.

nested_items.name: ExtraJarsS3Path
nested_items.description: Path to one or more Java .jar files in an S3 bucket that will be loaded in your DevEndpoint.

nested_items.name: FailureReason
nested_items.description: The reason for a current failure in this DevEndpoint.

nested_items.name: SecurityConfiguration
nested_items.description: The name of the SecurityConfiguration structure being used with this DevEndpoint.

nested_items.name: CreatedTimestamp
nested_items.description: The point in time at which this DevEndpoint was created.

nested_items.name: Arguments
nested_items.description: The map of arguments used to configure this DevEndpoint.
